description.narrative: By 2017, in selected districts and municipalities, families, especially the most vulnerable, practice essential maternal, adolescent, newborn, infant and young child feeding and early stimulation, hygiene and sanitation, with active involvement of male, family and community members

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs

title.narrative: Nepal United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, in selected districts and municipalities, families, especially the most vulnerable, practice essential maternal, adolescent, newborn, infant and young child feeding and early stimulation, hygiene and sanitation, with active involvement of male, family and community members

description.narrative: With support from UNICEF to Ministry of Health, more children are now able to receive timely mother's milk and are exclusively breastfed for six months through strengthened maternity protection provisions, baby friendly hospitals and Golden 1000 Day Communication Campaign. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of districts where WASH and ECD is fully integrated with IYCF

actual.value: 2017:WASH and ECD are included in the district nutrition programmes of 28 MSNP districts. Hygiene, sanitation and early childhood development are integral part of MSNP being implemented in 28 districts as well as the Golden 1000 Days campaign.

title.narrative: % of 6-23 months children (girls, boys and disadvantaged) fed with the three recommended IYCF practices in the MSNP, IMAM, MNP/IYCF, CFLG and IYCF-CG districts (disaggregated by ethnicity)

actual.value: 2018:As per NDHS 2016, 55% of children born in the last 2 years preceding the survey were breastfed within one hour of birth, 66% of the infants under age 6 months were exclusively breastfed, 84% of children were initiated timely to complementary feeding, 71% children 6-23 months were fed with minimum me

title.narrative: % of mothers (pregnant and lactating) who have at least three meals per day with at least one animal source foods in MSNP, IMAM, MNP/IYCF, CFLG and Child Cash grants supported districts (disaggregated by ethnicity)

actual.value: 2017:NDHS 2016 revealed that half of the women of reproductive age (15-49 years) had eaten food from 5 or more groups out of 10 food groups, 51% had eaten dark green leafy vegetables and 75% had eaten beans or legumes. Of the pregnant women, 34% had eaten meat, fish or poultry and 30% had eaten milk prod
